chat.msg: hey there, estas listo?
hello, si estoy listo
genial! entonces, estamos empezando cerca de una ramita que conduce a una pequeña isla con un tigre
¿adónde vamos primero?
primero tenemos que cruzar a la isla donde esta el elefante cruzando por en medio de el elefante y el pajaro
OK! Now I'm on the big island with the elephant and the parrot in the tree
and now that?
use the rocks to cross to the island donde esta la rana
got it! i'm now on the island with the frog
what's our next move?
cruza por arriba de el cocodrilo de vuelta a la isla donde esta el elefante
perfect! I have crossed and now I am back on the island with our little friend, the elephant
so, what can we do now?
use the rocks to cross to the small island where the giraffe is
¡está bien! Salté sobre las rocas y llegué a la isla donde se alza la jirafa.
from there take the path to the island donde este la serpiente y alli encontraras el tesoro
¡lo tengo! ya estoy en la isla con la serpiente
oh, y puedo ver el tesoro! *finished*
hi there, empezamos?
hola, si estoy listo
perfect, start by moving a few steps to the left, just below that wooden bench you see
cross the path towards the flower stand. but be careful, don't get too close to the florist
ok, estoy cerca de el flower stand, cruzo el bridge?
no, no, not yet
instead, pull a quick u-turn to your left here. you're going to cross the trail again and head back towards our white dog friend
ok estoy devuelta con el perro
great! now, head south, dodge that tree branch and keep going down
ok acabo de cruzar el rio and went down
good job! continue along this path until you spot another white dog next to a checkered picnic blanket
do you see it?
yes, just got to the white dog next to the checkered picnic blanket
¡fantástico! Súbete a la manta de picnic, saluda al cuenco de bayas y luego comienza a dirigirte hacia el oeste.
ok me fui a el oeste where there is another tree branch
exactly! now, cross this branch, but this time, head back northwards
ok cruze usando the branch
good job! now, see that green bush? make sure you don't touch it
just circle it from the right side until you reach the flower stand
ok eh llegado a el flower stand
awesome! now, make a left. we are moving away from the stand
you will see a big bridge with two bikers. just pass it to the west
ok acabo de cruzar el puente
a donde voy despues?
hey!!! ya comenzamos?
hola, yes im ready
awesome! i'm at the tent in the north
should i head south towards the dog?
yes, go south and then take a right towards the campfire
Listo, veo un hongo rojo a mi derecha.
¿debería dirigirme allí?
si, ve hacia el hongo rojo
cool, got it
Now, to the blue car south?
si, ve hacia el sur un poco hasta que llegues a el carro azul
alright, I'm looking at a blue telescope too
should i head that way?
head south until you reach the telescope
Te tengo, veo una casa de madera rodeada de rocas en el oeste.
¿me dirijo allí?
yes, go to the wooden cabin, that is your destination
Muy bien, estoy en la casa de madera.
*terminado* ¡Gracias por guiarme, amigo!
hey!!! ya comenzamos?
hola, estoy listo, estoy donde estan tres palmeras
brilliant! Now, I want you to head southwest, under the first palm tree
then turn right crossing the second palm tree. then, turn left before reaching the third palm tree and continue south
ok estoy debajo de la tercer palmera y veo un perro cafe
ah, that's great! pass on the left of that cute lil' puppy
afterwards, take a slight left and then make a right turn to the south
ok estoy enfrente en medio de una roca y de el perro
perfect! head straight between the big rock on your left and the smaller one on your right and you'll reach the water
ok, im in the water, infront of a crab
im in the water, donde esta un cangrejo
nice, you're doing awesome! now, take a right turn and walk west along the big rock, still in the water
ok I crossed the big rock, and there is a scary shark close by
jaja no te preocupes amigo
Mantén la calma y gira bruscamente a la derecha después de ver la roca que es un poco más pequeña que la que acabas de cruzar.
ok estoy en la roca mas chica
sweet! exit the water now, go between the medium rock and a colorful ball, and head back north
ok acabo de cruzar y veo un speaker and a tent
perfecto! turn slightly left, head northwest, and pass between that funky red tent and the speaker
ok, cruze por enfrente de el tent, y veo un kayak
alright! circle around the tent, then head south towards the water, but stop before you reach it
ok, im at the edge of the water
¡perfecto! ahora, gira a la derecha, pasa por debajo del kayak rojo y continúa hacia el oeste.
ok estoy debajo de el kayak rojo
great, now turn 90 degrees to the right, head north alongside the kayak until you reach a small green bush
you're there!

general_survey.answer: Yes, I currently live in the USA where English is the spoken language.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
Do you speak any additional languages? If so, please describe briefly here.
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both English and Spanish?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
When you hear others mixing languages in conversation, how do you feel about it?
How natural was your conversational partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: It felt a little random when the partner would switch languages.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: I mostly speak English in my day to day environment, so it currently feels a bit easier to use English as a form of communication. But as soon as I interact with someone who starts speaking to me in Spanish I find it easy to switch and match the language they are using.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
